Months after GM announced its ignition switch recall, parts to fix affected cars are finally arriving in greater numbers at dealerships.

But today he's hanging out at DeNooyer Chevrolet in Kalamazoo.
I am here because I have a 2009 Chevy Cobalt and it had got recalled - the ignition switch.
Belanger waited several weeks to get this appointment; he was never afraid to drive his Cobalt.

But his feelings about GM may have been affected by the recall.
Maybe a little bit.
A little bit - my dad works for General Motors too so I'll probably always buy GM cars, but it did - just hearing about the deaths; that was kind of tragic.
This kind of uneasiness among customers means dealers aren't just repairing cars; they're repairing relationships with General Motors.
Bill Garnett is the service manager here and says replacement parts are still not arriving as fast as he'd like.
That's a problem when customers call to schedule an appointment.

so far this year, including the ignition switch recall.

You can go to China or India or parts of Latin America and find progress in fighting poverty, disease and illiteracy.

HIV continues to spread.
Agricultural production on the continent has stagnated.
Millions of African children still lack access to clean water, basic health care and primary education.
